href=\"/sign_up?return_to=%2Ftesting-the-test-naplan-makes-for-stressed-kids-and-a-narrow-curriculum-10965\">Sign up as a reader</a>\n  </li>\n  <li class=\"reader-signin\">\n    <a class=\"slot\" data-id=\"14\"></div>\n    \n  <section id=\"header\">\n    <div class=\"wrapper nocontent\">\n      <header id=\"masthead\" class=\"clearfix\">\n  <a class=\"masthead-home-link\" href=\"/us\">\n    <img alt=\"The Conversation\" src=\"https://cdn.theconversation.com/static/tc/@theconversation/ui/dist/esm/logos/logo-en-2dbf43368862bc522cc1bcb6ac5833fc.svg\" />\n</a>\n  <form class=\"masthead-search\" action=\"/us/search\" accept-charset=\"UTF-8\" method=\"get\">\n    <fieldset>\n  <legend>Search</legend>\n  <div class=\"row\">\n    <div class=\"input-wrapper\">\n      <label for=\"q\"><i class=\"icon-search\"></i></label>\n      <input type=\"text\" name=\"q\" id=\"q\" value=\"\" placeholder=\"Search analysis, research, academics…\" />\n    </div>\n    <button type=\"submit\" class=\"button\" value=\"Search\"></button>\n  </div>\n</fieldset>\n\n</form>\n  <div class=\"masthead-tagline\">\n    Academic rigor, journalistic flair\n  </div>\n</header>\n\n      <nav id=\"primary-navigation\" class=\" nocontent\">\n  <ol>\n        <li class=\"covid-19\">\n          <a class=\"\" title=\"COVID-19\" href=\"/us/covid-19\">COVID-19</a>\n        </li>\n        <li class=\"arts\">\n          <a class=\"\" title=\"Arts + Culture\" href=\"/us/arts\">Arts <span><span title=\"and\">+</span> Culture</span></a>\n        </li>\n        <li class=\"business\">\n          <a class=\"\" title=\"Economy + Business\" href=\"/us/business\">Economy <span><span title=\"and\">+</span> Business</span></a>\n        </li>\n        <li class=\"education\">\n          <a class=\"\" title=\"Education\" href=\"/us/education\">Education</a>\n        </li>\n        <li class=\"environment\">\n          <a class=\"\" title=\"Environment + Energy\" title=\"and\">+</span> Technology</span></a>\n        </li>\n\n  </ol>\n</nav>\n\n    </div>\n  </section>\n\n\n    <div id=\"outer\">\n      \n\n      \n\n\n\n  <article id=\"article\" class=\"clearfix normal-article\" data-id=\"10965\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Article\">\n  \n\n    <div class=\"wrapper\">\n      <div class=\"content-header grid-sixteen\">\n        \n  <header class=\"content-header-container grid-twelve large-grid-eleven\">\n    <div>\n      <div class=\"content-header-block\">\n        <h1 class=\"legacy entry-title instapaper_title\" itemprop=\"name\">\n          <strong>\n            Testing the test: NAPLAN makes for stressed kids and a narrow&nbsp;curriculum\n          </strong>\n        </h1>\n      </div>\n    </div>\n    <time datetime=\"2012-11-25T19:08:33Z\" itemprop=\"datePublished\" content=\"2012-11-25T19:08:33Z\">November 25, 2012 2.08pm EST</time>\n  </header>\n\n      </div>\n    </div>\n\n  <div class=\"wrapper\">\n    <div class=\"content-sidebar grid-four large-grid-four grid-last\">\n\n      \n        <section class=\"content-authors\">\n  <div class=\"content-authors-synopsis\">\n    <a href=\"#\" class=\"content-authors-toggle\">\n      <i class=\"icon-caret-down\"></i>\n      <i class=\"icon-caret-up\"></i>\n      <span class=\"nobr\">Nicky Dulfer</span>, <em class=\"institution_name\">The University of Melbourne</em>\n    </a>\n  </div>\n\n      <div class=\"content-authors-group\">\n      <h3 class=\"border\">Author</h3>\n      <ol>\n        <li class=\"vcard\" id=\"author-17977\" itemprop=\"author\" itemscope=\"\" itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Person\">\n    <a rel=\"author\" href=\"/profiles/nicky-dulfer-16288\">\n      <img alt=\"\" class=\"lazyload\" data-src=\"https://cdn.theconversation.com/avatars/16288/width170/image-20200525-124822-c1c3gw.jpg\" src=\"https://cdn.theconversation.com/static/tc/author/width170_default-19ec5bd0b0425d75df0ad1707d18c36b.jpg\" itemprop=\"image\" />\n      <span class=\"fn author-name\" itemprop=\"name\">\n        Nicky Dulfer\n      </span>\n</a>\n    \n\n    <p class=\"role\">\n      Academic, Melbourne Graduate School of Education, The University of Melbourne\n    </p>\n\n</li>\n\n      </ol>\n    </div>\n\n</section>\n\n\n      \n    <section class=\"content-disclosure-statement\">\n      <h3 class=\"border\">Disclosure statement</h3>\n        <p><span>Nicky Dulfern&#39;s research was commissioned by the Whitlam Institute at the University of Western Sydney.</span></p>\n    </section>\n\n      \n\n  <section class=\"content-partners\">\n    <h3 class=\"border\">Partners</h3>\n\n    <p class=\"disclosure-logo clearfix\"><a class=\"logo\" href=\"/institutions/the-university-of-melbourne-722\"><img alt=\"University of Melbourne\" src=\"https://images.theconversation.com/institutions/722/logos/logo-1513124826.png?ixlib=rb-1.1.0&amp;q=45&amp;auto=format&amp;w=170&amp;h=170\" /></a></p>\n\n    <p class=\"funding-statement\"><a href=\"https://theconversation.com/institutions/the-university-of-melbourne-722\">University of Melbourne</a> provides funding as a founding partner of The Conversation AU.</p>\n\n\n    <p><a href=\"/us/partners\">View all partners</a></p>\n  </section>\n\n      \n\n      <section class=\"slot\" data-id=\"16\"></section>\n    </div>\n\n    <div class=\"grid-twelve large-grid-eleven\">\n        \n<figure class=\"content-lead-image grid-twelve large-grid-eleven\">\n  <div class=\"placeholder-container\" style=\"--aspect-ratio-percent:66.95464362850973%;--background-color:#b18f67\"><img class=\"lazyloaded\" src=\"https://images.theconversation.com/files/17962/original/jt558trs-1353642967.jpg?ixlib=rb-1.1.0&amp;rect=23%2C5%2C3831%2C2573&amp;q=45&amp;auto=format&amp;w=926&amp;fit=clip\" data-id=\"17962\" itemprop=\"image\" /></div>\n    <figcaption>\n      Literacy and numeracy tests are having a negative impact on Australian students.\n      <span class=\"attribution\"><span class=\"source\">Test image from www.shutterstock.com</span></span>\n    </figcaption>\n</figure>\n\n\n      \n\n\n      <div class=\"top\">\n        \n  <aside class=\"grid-two content-social-distribution\">\n    <ul>\n      <li class=\"email\">\n        <a class=\"email-button\" data-id=\"10965\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"mailto:?subject=Testing%20the%20test%3A%20NAPLAN%20makes%20for%20stressed%20kids%20and%20a%20narrow%20curriculum%20%E2%80%94%20The%20Conversation&amp;body=Hi.%20I%20found%20an%20article%20that%20you%20might%20like%3A%20%22Testing%20the%20test%3A%20NAPLAN%20makes%20for%20stressed%20kids%20and%20a%20narrow%20curriculum%22%20%E2%80%94%20https%3A%2F%2Ftheconversation.com%2Ftesting-the-test-naplan-makes-for-stressed-kids-and-a-narrow-curriculum-10965\"><i class=\"icon-email\"></i> <span>Email</span></a>\n      </li>\n\n      <li class=\"twitter\">\n        <a class=\"twitter-button\" data-url=\"https://theconversation.com/testing-the-test-naplan-makes-for-stressed-kids-and-a-narrow-curriculum-10965\" data-id=\"10965\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Testing+the+test%3A+NAPLAN+makes+for+stressed+kids+and+a+narrow+curriculum&amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Ftheconversation.com%2Ftesting-the-test-naplan-makes-for-stressed-kids-and-a-narrow-curriculum-10965%3Futm_source%3Dtwitter%26utm_medium%3Dbylinetwitterbutton&amp;utm_campaign=none&amp;via=ConversationEDU\"><i class=\"icon-twitter\"></i> <span>Twitter</span></a>\n      </li>\n\n      <li class=\"facebook\">\n        <a class=\"facebook-button\" data-url=\"https://theconversation.com/testing-the-test-naplan-makes-for-stressed-kids-and-a-narrow-curriculum-10965\" data-id=\"10965\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Ftheconversation.com%2Ftesting-the-test-naplan-makes-for-stressed-kids-and-a-narrow-curriculum-10965%3Futm_source%3Dfacebook%26utm_medium%3Dbylinefacebookbutton\"><i class=\"icon-facebook\"></i> <span>Facebook</span></a>\n      </li>\n\n      <li class=\"linkedin\">\n        <a class=\"linkedin-button\" data-url=\"https://theconversation.com/testing-the-test-naplan-makes-for-stressed-kids-and-a-narrow-curriculum-10965\" data-id=\"10965\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&amp;source=The+Conversation&amp;summary=NAPLAN+tests+%E2%80%93+the+literacy+and+numeracy+tests+given+to+primary+and+secondary+students+%E2%80%93+are+causing+health+problems+and+promoting+a+culture+of+%22teaching+to+the+test%22.%0A%0AA+national+study+released+to...&amp;title=Testing+the+test%3A+NAPLAN+makes+for+stressed+kids+and+a+narrow+curriculum&amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Ftheconversation.com%2Ftesting-the-test-naplan-makes-for-stressed-kids-and-a-narrow-curriculum-10965%3Futm_source%3Dlinkedin%26utm_medium%3Dbylinelinkedinbutton\"><i class=\"icon-linkedin\"></i> <span>LinkedIn</span></a>\n      </li>\n\n      <li class=\"whatsapp\">\n        <a class=\"whatsapp-button\" data-href=\"https://theconversation.com/testing-the-test-naplan-makes-for-stressed-kids-and-a-narrow-curriculum-10965\" data-action=\"share/whatsapp/share\" data-id=\"10965\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"whatsapp://send?text=Testing+the+test%3A+NAPLAN+makes+for+stressed+kids+and+a+narrow+curriculum+https%3A%2F%2Ftheconversation.com%2Ftesting-the-test-naplan-makes-for-stressed-kids-and-a-narrow-curriculum-10965%3Futm_source%3Dwhatsapp%26utm_medium%3Dbylinewhatsappbutton\"><i class=\"icon-whatsapp\"></i> <span>WhatsApp</span></a>\n      </li>\n\n      <li class=\"fb-messenger\">\n        <a class=\"fb-messenger-button\" data-href=\"https://theconversation.com/testing-the-test-naplan-makes-for-stressed-kids-and-a-narrow-curriculum-10965\" data-action=\"share/fb-messenger/share\" data-id=\"10965\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"fb-messenger://share?link=https%3A%2F%2Ftheconversation.com%2Ftesting-the-test-naplan-makes-for-stressed-kids-and-a-narrow-curriculum-10965%3Futm_source%3Dfb_messenger%26utm_medium%3Dbylinefb_messenger_button\"><i class=\"icon-fb-messenger\"></i> <span>Messenger</span></a>\n      </li>\n    </ul>\n  </aside>\n\n      </div>\n\n      \n  <div class=\"grid-ten large-grid-nine grid-last content-body content entry-content instapaper_body inline-promos\" itemprop=\"articleBody\">\n    <p>NAPLAN tests – the literacy and numeracy tests given to primary and secondary students – are causing health problems and promoting a culture of “teaching to the test”.</p>\n\n<p>A national study released today surveyed around 8,300 teachers and found the tests had unintended consequences, particularly on how the curriculum was taught, student health and school reputation.</p>\n\n<p>Melbourne University’s Nicky Dulfer discusses the findings below. </p>\n\n<h2>What are the major findings in the study?</h2>\n\n<p>The major findings can be broken down into four key areas. The first major finding is around the fact that teachers are really unsure as to the purpose of NAPLAN. </p><div class=\"slot clear\" data-id=\"17\">\n<div class=\"inline-promos-skeleton\">\n  <h5></h5>\n  <button></button>\n</div>\n</div>\n\n<p>We asked teachers and educators across the whole of the nation: what do you think NAPLAN is for? And they think it’s a school ranking tool, they thinking it’s a method of policing school performance. Some say it might be a diagnostic tool but that it doesn’t quite fit that role.</p>\n\n<p>So there’s some confusion about what the purpose of NAPLAN is.</p>\n\n<p>The second finding is to do with enrolments. And the idea that if you were a school that got poor results in NAPLAN, or poorer than expected results in a NAPLAN test, how that might affect your school. And teachers felt overwhelmingly that it could affect media reporting about the school, which would affect the reputation of the school, how parents felt about the school, how staff felt, the morale of the students and the staff and also it could affect the school’s ability to attract and retain teachers and students.</p>\n\n<p>We also asked about areas around health and well-being. But teachers were only allowed to talk about students who had reported issues or parents who had reported issues. We didn’t want teachers to say “I’ve heard about issues”, they needed to have hard evidence.</p>\n\n<p>And they reported that they had a number of students who said they were feeling stressed, there were students that were concerned they were too dumb to sit the NAPLAN.</p>\n\n<p>There was a fear of parents’ reactions to the test results, if the school performed lower than expected. There were some teachers who reported that kids do feel sick before the test or freeze during the test. There’s some sleeplessness and some crying.</p>\n\n<p>Teachers also responded with anecdotes in that section – there were many stories of kids not wanting to go to school and things like that.</p>\n\n<p>The final area that we looked into and asked teachers about is the one that teachers have the most control over and are also the people that know the most about it. And that is the impact of the testing on curriculum and teaching. </p>\n\n<p>And we asked them what the impacts on the curriculum and teaching are, and there were some very strong results about the fact that NAPLAN preparation is taking up a lot of time in a crowded curriculum, that there are other curriculum areas that are seen as not as important because they’re not tested. That they teach more to the test, so they make sure that they cover the knowledge that’s on the test, and that means that they’re not teaching other things. </p>\n\n<p>It has actually reduced the amount of face-to-face talking time they have with their students and it’s narrowed the range of teaching strategies. </p>\n\n<p>We also asked them about how they were able to use the NAPLAN results and how useful it was. One of the overwhelming responses was that it comes through so late, that it’s not as useful as they would like. They can’t use it as a diagnostic tool.</p>\n\n<p>So predominantly they said they looked through the data and they checked if there were any surprises – if students were performing well-above expected or well-below expected.</p>\n\n<h2>Does the study then offer new information or does it confirm what we already know?</h2>\n\n<p>It’s the first time to my knowledge that NAPLAN has been looked at nationally from this perspective. </p>\n\n<p>We know that in other countries there’s been great criticism of high-stakes testing. There have been times in Australia when people have said NAPLAN isn’t a high-stakes test, it’s not treated in that way.</p>\n\n<p>But given these findings, NAPLAN is a high-stakes test because it does have consequences for students’ success and teacher practice. </p>\n\n<p>The study confirms that what is happening overseas is also happening here. But it’s the first national study of its kind, to my knowledge, that asks teachers what is happening in your classroom because of NAPLAN. We also had over 8,000 responses so it’s a strong study from that point of view.</p>\n\n<h2>Given your findings, do you think NAPLAN should be reformed or replaced? What are the alternatives?</h2>\n\n<p>I don’t think it needs to be abolished but I think that we do need to start to look at some of the impacts of NAPLAN, intended and unintended. And to actually enter into a conversation about it – after all it’s one test on one day, it’s been given a lot of importance, it’s been put up on the website, and it has an ability to impact on all these aspects.</p>\n\n<p>So can we de-emphasise it in some way? Can we make sure that parents understand that it’s not the be all and end all? Can we de-pressurise the situation?</p>\n\n<p>Do we need to run it every second year, for example? We need to think about the way that it is impacting on students and see if there are other ways. </p>\n\n<p>I’m not saying it’s a useless measure, but it something that is now having quite severe unintended consequences that we need to look into and ask, is there anything we can do?</p>\n\n<h2>This study focuses on teachers’ perceptions of the effects of NAPLAN – are there other ways to measure its effects? Is there more research needed?</h2>\n\n<p>Absolutely, this is just the tip of iceberg. We’ve only asked the teachers at this point. Certainly this study is a first step, we’re also hoping to ask the students themselves for their opinions and ask parental opinions.</p>\n\n<p>But we also need to understand the research and the policy that sits behind it as well. But what we were seeking to do was get a voice from those educators who have largely, remained fairly quiet on the issue until now.</p>\n  </div>\n\n      \n\n      \n    <div class=\"grid-ten grid-prepend-two large-grid-nine grid-last content-topics topic-list\">\n      <i class=\"icon-tag\"></i>\n      <ul>\n          <li class=\"topic-list-item\">\n            <a href=\"/topics/education-274\">Education</a>\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"topic-list-item\">\n            <a href=\"/topics/schools-275\">Schools</a>\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"topic-list-item\">\n            <a href=\"/topics/tests-1987\">Tests</a>\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"topic-list-item\">\n            <a href=\"/topics/teachers-2978\">Teachers</a>\n          </li>\n          <li class=\"topic-list-item\">\n            <a href=\"/topics/naplan-3001\">NAPLAN</a>\n          </li>\n      </ul>\n    </div>\n\n      \n    </div>\n\n    <div class=\"slot grid-ten grid-prepend-two large-grid-nine grid-last mb5\" data-id=\"15\"></div>\n\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"wrapper\">\n    <div class=\"react-content-related-container\" data-article-id=\"10965\"></div>\n  </div>\n</article>\n\n\n<div id=\"comments-container\"></div>\n\n\n  <div class=\"page-addendum\">\n  <div class=\"wrapper\">\n    <div class=\"grid-sixteen grid-last\">\n      \n<div id=\"addendum-write\" class=\"addendum-block want-to-write\">\n  <h3 class=\"border\">Want to write?</h3>\n  <p>\n    Write an article and join a growing community of more than 135,500 academics and researchers from 4,195 institutions.\n  </p>\n  <p class=\"more\">\n    <a class=\"button\" href=\"/become-an-author\">Register now</a>\n  </p>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n</div>\n\n\n\n  <script src=\"https://theconversation.com/javascripts/lib/content_tracker_hook.js\" data-id=\"13\"></div>\n\n    <script src=\"https://cdn.theconversation.com/static/tc/content-2f2fdbd017d2a462ef79.js\"></script>\n\n  <script>\n//<![CDATA[\n\n  TC.locale = \"en-US\";\n  TC.env =
